runs.comm: just the start that West Indies were hoping for. Jarvis sends one down on middle and leg, with fine leg up, and a neat little glance bounces away to the boundary.
that's much better from Jarvis. Perhaps a little short of a length, but nicely straight and Charles hops to defend.
Charles sets a solid base at the crease and hoicks wildly at this length delivery, which is bowled with good pace and is through him in a flash. Play and miss.
short outside off, and Charles angles a cut shot down to third man.
pitched right up to the bat, Jarvis looking for what little swing may be on offer. Simmons gets forward and taps to mid-on.
a good finish to the over for Jarvis, Simmons leaning half forward to defend a 132.5kph length delivery to extra cover.
pitched right up, and straight. Charles works it off the legs for a single to square with minimum fuss. Not a bad loosener from Mpofu, at 132kph.
even better from Mpofu. He hurries Simmons' defense with a delivery up above 134kph, the right-hander hopping to defend.

Mpofu found some fire in his belly towards the end of the final ODI, and he appears to have carried it on into this game. This delivery is nudging 136kph as Simmons plays a tip-and-run shot to cover point.
Charles swivels to pull, but the ball gets big on him and strikes him above the hip, rolling to off.
a slower offcutter is played down to gully, but Simmons is caught wrong-footed and they don't take what could have been a sharp single. His bat was in the wrong hand too.
another slower ball to end the over, just 119.5kph, and Charles is a little early on the pull this time. The ball stays a little low to scoot under his bat, but the stumps weren't in danger.

a half chance goes begging! Jarvis dug one in, and Simmons didn't bother to keep the pull stroke down. Ervine wasn't the sharpest off the mark at deep square leg, but he rushed forward and put in a valiant dive to try and get his fingers underneath the ball. The ball landed just in front of him.
a slower ball is dispatched through extra cover! This was absolutely hammered, Charles keeping his weight on the back knee and leathering a full, wide delivery in true Caribbean style.
and another! Having slipped too full, Jarvis now sends this one down too short and a pull shot sends the ball rocketing out to long leg.
three in a row! Full again, and Charles moves fluidly into position to lace a drive through cover.

a slower ball bouncer is paddled to fine leg, where Mushangwe is slow getting across to it, and it's another boundary! A better effort might've stopped this, but the ball wasn't a good one, and that makes it four boundaries in a row. Jarvis is leaking runs all over the place.
Carnage! Jarvis has bowled too lengths in this over, and neither with any success. Another short one is bludgeoned in front of square on the leg side.
oh dear, and Mpofu doesn't start too well either. Speared down the leg side, called wide.
that's much better, on a length and nicely straight. Good pace too, above 136kph, and Simmons defends.
punched off the back foot, but a diving extra cover stops the run.
the slower ball this time, and offcutter, and Simmons can't get it through the off side field.
finally the single comes, Simmons chopping this rising quick delivery down to Sibanda's left at point. Charles calls him through.

plumb! Mpofu has struck for Zimbabwe, pinning the dangerous Johnson Charles in front of his stumps. This was a canny piece of bowling, a slower ball that cut in quite sharply off the track to strike Charles in front of middle. Mpofu roared an appeal, and then roared in celebration as the finger went up. That'll raise Zimbabwe's spirits.
Mpofu is bowling with some gas out there now. This delivery is up over 138kph, and is shot across Darren Bravo's bows as he opts to leave.
welcome to the crease young man! Simmons latches onto a flighted delivery and heaves it over wide long on.
Tino pushes this one through much quicker, and Simmons stays deep to whip two runs wide of long on.

and another! This goes even further. It was a very poor delivery, a long hop, and Simmons sent it sailing over wide long on with a thwack. It was a graceless stroke, just a swipe across the line, but it came clean out of the middle.
eased down to long on for the single.
Bravo cuts, but the stroke goes straight to point.
Bravo flicks across his front pad, exciting Taylor, and finds midwicket this time.
rising off a length, Simmons is tucked up in defense as the ball seams in to him.
Mpofu offers some width outside off this time, but Simmons can't time the cut.
Mpofu is in the midst of a fantastic spell. He picks up his 12th dot ball with a full, length delivery that tails in through the air to test Simmons' defense.
the slower ball is just a little too straight, and Simmons works a single to long on.
he's got another one! How quick was this? Too quick for Darren Bravo as he rocked back and aimed to pull. The ball came off the splice and looped up to give Chibhabha an easy catch at mid-on.
smell that! Dwayne Bravo is greeted with a bristling bouncer at 135.7kph ... but it bristles just a little too enthusiastically, and is called wide as it rises over the ducking batsman.

Bravo is off the mark with a nudge off his hip ... ooh, and they rush back for the second! Bravo really had to motor there, and a stronger throw from the deep would have really tested him. Taylor is clearly frustrated, and wants more from his troops.
Mutombodzi continues, Simmons playing him rather more softly out through cover point - with the spin - for a single.
Bravo chops a legspinner down between two men in the covers, and Simmons calls him through.
Simmons is forward to drive, but picks out extra cover.
well flighted by Mutombodzi, the ball drifting in to beat Simmons' attempted flick and strike him on the pad. Slipping down leg.
a touch too wide. Simmons waits on the ball to spin, cutting out to Mpofu at deep point.
the slider from Mutombodzi, but it goes down the leg side.
driven down to long on to end the over.

Taylor fumbles, Bravo survives! Bravo tapped the ball to cover point, and wanted a single. It was never on, and Chibhabha swooped in a flash to fling the ball at Taylor. Bravo was well short ... but Taylor fumbled, dropping the ball and breaking the stumps with his empty gloves! That could well be a costly miss. The umpire asks for a replay to confirm whether it's out or not, and Taylor's error becomes clear to all.
a poor line from Utseya sends the ball spinning down the leg side. Was there any bat on this? Either way, the ball rolls quickly enough to evade a diving Jarvis down at fine leg.
turned with the spin again, but this time to midwicket.
this time Bravo places it well enough to get a single to long on.
Simmons dabs to backward point, where Mutombodzi stops the single.
again Simmons plays towards Mutombodzi, but this time there's room for a single before the throw comes in.
Simmons flicks against the spin into the leg side.
Bravo follows suit, the single coming on the leg side.
too short, sitting up and Simmons pulls out to deep midwicket.
Bravo stretches well forward to drive through cover.
Simmons wants a single as he defends towards the covers, but there's none to be had.
cut hard, but straight to point.
flicked into the leg side for an easy single.
Simmons follows suit, playing with the spin.
Bravo looks to sweep, but can't connect.
this time he does connect, a single the result.
tapped towards point, where the fielder is quickly in.
chopped down behind square, this time there is space for one.
a massive heave connects with nothing but fresh air. Some turn and bounce for Mushangwe.
he's hit this one! Simmons slog-sweeps and the ball flies straight out the middle. Resounding crack off the bat.
tapped down behind point, quick single.
Bravo flashes outside off, but is beaten by turn and bounce.
pushed through much quicker, driven straight to the cover fielder.
shot! Bravo leans into a drive, playing with the spin up and over extra cover.
a full toss is thrashed out through the covers, and there's a fielder in the deep to clean up.
turned to midwicket, straight to the fielder.
quicker, flatter through the air, and this time it's past the midwicket fielder.
both batsmen are happy to keep playing the spin. There is some on offer for Utseya, but it's somewhat predictable.
speared down the leg side, the turn taking it further.
Bravo aims for midwicket, but a diving fielder stops the run.
another lightning-quick over ends with a single to long on.
too short, heaved out to deep midwicket, where Craig Ervine taps the ball back into play.
leathered over deep midwicket. Ervine would have to be several rows deep in the crowd to catch that one.
pushed through quicker outside off, the ball fizzing past the bat.
and another! Something of a slog sweep from Simmons, and the ball rockets miles over long on. Is there any stopping West Indies now?
dabbed away behind square.
and Bravo ends the over with another marvellous loft over extra cover. Played with the spin, so the risk was lessened, but he still had to hit it well. Which he did.
Utseya begins with an appeal for lbw, Simmons stretching forward, but he's hit outside the line.
turned off the pads, this time he lays bat on ball.
shot! Bravo is ending this match in style. He steps way back to leg, making room, and smears another lofted cover drive over wide long off for six. A characteristic Bravo stroke.
and he follows that up with a single, good thinking.
Simmons goes to fifty! He's unruffled, simply leaning back to poke to leg and ambling through. Warm applause from the crowd.
flashed out to deep cover to end the over.
full, right up to the bat, and it's dug out down the ground.
a slower ball from Simmons, and it's chopped to point.
flicked down the ground with flourish.
wide of off stump, Bravo's bat sends the ball out in that direction.
slapped over point! Jarvis went full and wide again. Simmons stayed very deep in the crease, shoveling at the ball to deliberately lift it over backward point. His first four, incidentally!
you can't hit those. Jarvis ends his over with a pinpoint, slower ball yorker that is bottom edged into the toe.
angling in towards the pads, and it's glanced to short fine leg, where Jarvis dives to cut off the boundary.
Mpofu's still got wheels, Bravo ducking under a 136.1kph bouncer.
Mpofu follows that up with a slower ball, which Bravo places softly into the gap at cover.
Simmons aims an ugly heave at a 111kph slower ball, cue-ending the ball down to long on.
chipped in the air out to deep midwicket.
Mpofu ends his spell, and his work for the day, with an inswinging yorker that only just misses its mark, Simmons digging it out into the leg side.
Lendl Simmons ends the game in emphatic style, clubbing his sixth six down the ground off a high full toss.
